commit.message:
Release 2.0.3

Signed-off-by: Ludovic Rousseau <ludovic.rousseau@free.fr>

Add SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MNG back

I now discover that Windows does define BOTH symbols with the same
value.:
- SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MSG 0x8010002B in
  https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-rdpesc/9861f8da-76fe-41e6-847e-40c9aa35df8d
- SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MNG 0x8010002B in
  https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/secauthn/authentication-return-values

To avoid breaking existing code the old symbol is back.
See https://bugs.debian.org/1065380

github actions: use actions/checkout@v4

Fixes:
Node.js 16 actions are deprecated. Please update the following actions to use Node.js 20: actions/checkout@v3. For more information see: https://github.blog/changelog/2023-09-22-github-actions-transitioning-from-node-16-to-node-20/.

Release 2.0.2

Signed-off-by: Ludovic Rousseau <ludovic.rousseau@free.fr>

Fix typo in (unused) error code SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MSG

Windows documentation says:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-rdpesc/9861f8da-76fe-41e6-847e-40c9aa35df8d
  SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MSG 0x8010002B
  An unrecognized error code was returned from a layered component.

Thanks to rhoog-ine for the bug report
" Error symbol SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MNG should be SCARD_E_UNKNOWN_RES_MSG #169 "
Closes: https://github.com/LudovicRousseau/PCSC/issues/169

Use a fixed date in pcsc-spy.1 manpage

The manpage pcsc-spy.1 is generated by pod2an from pcsc-spy.pod. The
date included in the manpage is the current date of generation.
This caused problems when installing libpcsclite-dev for 2 different
architectures at the same time.

Thanks to Francois Gouget for the bug report
"Bug#1064636: libpcsclite-dev: The i386 libpcsclite-dev 2.0.1-1+b1 package conflicts with the amd64 one"
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1064636

Fix grammar (#167)

Thanks

Fix grammar (#167)

Thanks

commit.message:
Fix typos

Thanks to spaette for the bug report
https://github.com/LudovicRousseau/PCSC/issues/166

PHSetProtocol(): negotiate PTS also for the backup protocol

If the first call to IFDSetPTS() fails with IFD_PROTOCOL_NOT_SUPPORTED
or IFD_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED and another protocol can be negotiated then
we call IFDSetPTS() with this second/backup protocol instead of doing
nothing.

This allows the driver to correctly configure the reader with the
selected protocol.

This happens if a card supports both T=0 and T=1, the application uses
SCARD_PROTOCOL_ANY but the reader only supports T=0.
1. The first protocol tried is T=1 (preferred over T=0).
2. If the T=1 PTS negotiation fails then we try T=0.
3. If the T=0 PTS negotiation fails then we report an error.

The step 3 was missing.

PHSetProtocol(): do not use a protocol not selected

If the application requests T=1 for a card that support both T=0 and T=1
and that the PTS using T=1 fails then we should not try to use T=0.

This is the case if the reader does not support T=1 but only T=0.

Thanks to Dmitry for the bug report
" Erroneously success of SCardConnect in case of T=0 reader #162 "
https://github.com/LudovicRousseau/PCSC/issues/162

SCardConnect() & SCardReconnect(): restrict the protocol used

We should not try to use a protocol that is not in the preferred ones
from the application.
If the application requests to use T=1 only but the card does support T=0
& T=1, and the reader does support T=0 only we should NOT try to use T=0
but fail instead.

SCardConnect() & SCardReconnect() will now return SCARD_E_PROTO_MISMATCH.

This should match the Windows behavior.

Thanks to Dmitry for the bug report
" Erroneously success of SCardConnect in case of T=0 reader #162 "
https://github.com/LudovicRousseau/PCSC/issues/162
pcscd.8.in: improve formatting
pcscd.8: add "CONFIGURATION FILE" section
pcscd.8: document --disable-polkit

Release 2.0.1

Signed-off-by: Ludovic Rousseau <ludovic.rousseau@free.fr>

github actions: disable polkit

Github actions provides Ubuntu 22.04 which does provide polkit version < 0.111
So we can't use it.

We have to wait until Ubuntu 24.04 is available.

configure.in: polkit is enabled by default

Use --disable-polkit if you do not want to use polkit.
configure: minor reformat

configure: replace "case in" by AS_CASE() M4 macro

https://autotools.info/autoconf/m4sh.html

configure: replace "if then" by AS_IF() M4 macro

https://autotools.info/autoconf/m4sh.html

Access LockCount in a thread safe way

The field .LockCount can be used from different theads at the same
time.

We define it as _Atomic to have atomic accesses to the field and fix a
TSAN warning:
==================

Access readerSharing in a thread safe way

The field .readerSharing can be used from different theads at the same
time.

We define it as _Atomic to have atomic accesses to the field and fix a
TSAN warning:
==================

Fix an issue on pcscd exit

When pcscd exits we must first terminate any client thread on the
server side before closing the reader threads.
This is to prevent a client thread to access a now deactivated reader.

The error was:
^C00250854 [140433941325504] pcscdaemon.c:192:signal_thread() Received signal: 2
00000036 [140433941325504] pcscdaemon.c:226:signal_thread() Preparing for suicide
[...readers are stopped here...]
00000042 [140433995138368] pcscdaemon.c:809:at_exit() cleaning /run/pcscd
[...but we get a new request from a client...]
00000016 [140433906050752] winscard_svc.c:384:ContextThread() Received command: CMD_WAIT_READER_STATE_CHANGE from client 12

==================
etc..

Fix a crash

We must check that sReadersContexts[i] pointer is valid before
dereferencing it.
RFWaitForReaderInit() is called for CMD_GET_READERS_STATE &
CMD_WAIT_READER_STATE_CHANGE which may happen at any time.

00000048 [140737258038976] winscard_svc.c:365:ContextThread() Received command: CMD_WAIT_READER_STATE_CHANGE from client 12

Thread 7 "pcscd" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 0x7ffff245a6c0 (LWP 53656)]
0x00005555555f3c2f in __tsan_atomic64_load ()
(gdb) bt
    at winscard_svc.c:423
    at ./nptl/pthread_create.c:442
(gdb) f 1
1431				if (sReadersContexts[i]->vHandle != NULL)
(gdb) p i
$1 = 0
(gdb) p sReadersContexts
$2 = {0x0 <repeats 16 times>}
(gdb) p sReadersContexts[i]
$3 = (READER_CONTEXT *) 0x0
(gdb)

Update code to handle Atomic pointer

The reader library handle is now _Atomic so is no more a simple (void *).

readerfactory.c:883:25: error: incompatible pointer types passing '_Atomic(LPVOID) *' to parameter of type 'void **' [-Werror,-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
        return DYN_LoadLibrary(&rContext->vHandle, rContext->library);
                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
./dyn_generic.h:44:30: note: passing argument to parameter here
        LONG DYN_LoadLibrary(void **, char *);
                                    ^
readerfactory.c:1002:26: error: incompatible pointer types passing '_Atomic(LPVOID) *' to parameter of type 'void **' [-Werror,-Wincompatible-pointer-types]
                (void)DYN_CloseLibrary(&rContext->vHandle);
                                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
./dyn_generic.h:45:31: note: passing argument to parameter here
        LONG DYN_CloseLibrary(void **);
                                     ^

DYN_LoadLibrary/DYN_CloseLibrary: change API

Do not use a double pointer indirection for the handle.
This is needed for the next patch.

Fix data race on reader disconnect

The field .vHandle is used to check the validity of the reader.

It is accessed in write mode in RFUnloadReader() from a thread A while
it is also accessed in read mode in RFWaitForReaderInit() from thread B.

==================

==================

Fix data race issue accessing a logging variable

The struct timeval used in log_line() can't be accessed in a atomic way
so we should protect it using a mutex.

==================

SUMMARY: ThreadSanitizer: data race /PCSC-debug/src/debuglog.c:217 in log_line
==================

Thanks to Stefan Ehmann for the bug report and patch.

Fix a thread safe issue accessing contextsList

ContextsDeinitialize() was called by thread A in the middle of
list_delete() from thread B.
We already have a mutex to protect access to contextsList.

==================
